title: Dedication by a curator of the res publica Liparitanorum
support: A polished slab of white marble, broken into six joining fragments, with only the left margin partially preserved.

layout.p: The remains of six evenly spaced lines of Latin letters are preserved, with a regular left margin; the right margin is not preserved for any line

handNote.lettering: The letters are well cut in a relatively refined v-cut, with modest serifs. The letters are tend towards the tall and narrow and are very regular and evenly spaced.  P and R are open, O is somewhat ovoid, E has bars of equal length, D is quite full, the diagonal of the N does not always start from the top of the first hasta. Interpuncts are not consistently used, with one elegant example in line 2

date._: later 2nd or 3rd century CE (Vallarino on palaeographic grounds)

provenanceFound._: Found in secondary deposition during excavations in the summer of 2015: in a substantial stratum of waste material (US2211), dateable to the C4 CE, in a trench to the north of the 'West stenopos' in the western part of the area of the 'Hellenistic-Roman temple'

museum.name: Museo Regionale Archeologico Pietro Griffo
museum.description: Comprehensive collection of archaeological material discovered at the site of Agrigento and in Agrigento province, organised both by chronology and type across a number of rooms and corridors

location.address: Contrada San Nicola, 12 Valley of the Temples, 92100 - Agrigento (AG)
